intro: Goniothalamus malayanus, commonly known as the Malayan goniothalamus, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Myristicaceae and is characterized by its aromatic, leathery leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are typically orange or red in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland and hill forest areas. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
